questionTitle: Which of the following is also known as MPEG-4 AVC?
questionExplanation: AVC stands for Advanced Video Coding.

questionOption1: Video streaming is a high data-rate transfer activity that benefits greatly from the cloud
questionOption2: Very few video services are already cloud-based
questionOption3: Audio streaming has enabled low-cost distribution of news and entertainment
questionExplanation: Many video services are already cloud-based.

questionTitle: ITU-T Video Coding Experts Group (VCEG) and the ISO/IEC Moving Picture Experts Group (MPEG) created the __________ standard.
Which of the following format is not suitable for cloud-based implementation meant for large audiences?
questionExplanation: Older and less capable formats such as H.263, MPEG-4 Part 2, and MPEP-2 are still in use.

questionOption1: In order to support a range of devices, the Advanced Video Coding defines a set of profiles to support specific device types
questionOption2: The profiles in most widespread use are Main and High, with the Baseline and Extended profiles in use for mobile devices
questionOption3: The codec that compresses/decompresses the video content uses a block-oriented motion-compensation scheme
questionExplanation: H.264 defines a standard for encoding content, but that the implementation of a codec can vary.

questionTitle: Which of the following uses the Vorbis audio codec and the Matroska container file structure?
questionExplanation: This container file format is encoded/decoded by the VP8 video codec, which was developed by On2 and now owned by Google.

questionTitle: ________ is the iconic flash video-sharing service now owned by Google.
questionExplanation: To use YouTube inside a browser, you need to have Adobe Flash installed on your computer.

questionTitle: YouTube Mobile uses ___________ streaming to make video available on other mobile phone platforms.
questionExplanation: YouTube has developed a simplified interface for TV display called YouTube XL.

questionTitle: Which of the following is an open-source royalty-free media file format that has been optimized for the Web?
questionExplanation: It can also be used to carry HTML5 content.

questionTitle: Which of the following video format can be uploaded on Youtube?
questionExplanation: Ogg is a free, open container format maintained by the Xiph.Org Foundation.
